channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish bags and litter on Tabard street, 24th November
item.description:
There are rubbish bags and litter next to the planters on Tabard Street. It was reported 24 hours ago and fixmystreet stated it had been cleared. However, the rubbish bags and litter has not been cleaned up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chair dumped on Tabard Street, 24th November
item.description:
There is a chair dumped at the tree on Tabard Street. It was reported two days ago and fixmystreet stated it has been removed. However, the chair is still there today - five days later. It still needs to be removed by Southwark Council.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gaude Road is an unsafe road, 24th November
item.description:
This was reported weeks ago. Wheelchair users cannot use the path, pavement or street. The street is full of rubbish and leaves. No cleaners attend the street or ever clean this street. This is a public health issue I will contact my MP.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gauden Road, Clapham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parked illegally daily, 24th November
item.description:
The same vehicle has been parking on an unmarked illegal parking space in flintmill cresent for the past month on a weekly basis. The van was reported but no action was taken . It’s a great dark grey transit with a cab with blacked out windows . The van also has NO M.O.T . This van blocks a pedestrian pathway way restricting wheelchair/pushchair access. And does this on a daily basis . Action is required.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Flintmill Crescent, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ashfield parade illegal parking problem, 24th November
item.description:
Around Ashfield parade there is a continuous illegal parking problem causing a great deal of distress for local residents; This problem seems to be caused by non-nationals illegally parking: 1. On the taxi rank 2. On corners causing obstructions and bottlenecks to traffic flow 3. No traffic enforcement is in effect whatsoever 4. Double yellow lines must be painted on all the corners and bends on and around Ashfield parade and surrounding roads; 5. The taxi rank is of no use to taxi's and is being used soley as car parking by non-national tradesmen; 6. Why is this problem being ignored ??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-16, Burleigh Gardens, Brunswick Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside number 7 camden mews, 24th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-5, Camden Mews, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More dumped rubbish, 24th November
item.description:
Sorry More dumped rubbish in the bus shelter outside 121 Okehampton crescent Thank you for clearing the pain tins today Now we have polystyrene coving in a carrier bag We have posted it on the road wassap group to see if any one see the dumping Thank you

item.title: Synergy Development & Lime bikes, 24th November
item.description:
Hi there, This afternoon the line of Lime bikes appeared out of the blue outside my development. This pavement is used for offloading for Nisa Local shop and used by pedestrians. Why the bikes have been stationed there? These bikes create a lot of mess in the development and frankly speaking we as residents don't want them outside of our homes. Please Lime bikes company remove them and instead put them next to train station where there should be stationed. Best, L

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Way, Charlton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Thompson Road, East Dulwich, Greater London

item.title: Urgent. Rain flooding through pavement cracks into our basement, 24th November
item.description:
Urgent. Rain water is flooding through the huge cracks in the road and pavement into our house basement. The house vaults contain our electrical meters which have fused and are a fire risk. Outside 106 Finborough Road. We need the pavement fixed to stop water flooding so we can safely fix the electrics. The cracks have been there for months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 106, Finborough Road, Earl's Court, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
